title: [1982] Non Stop Ecstatic Dancing [EP] - Soft Cell - 68 4mb @ 320
description:
Non Stop Ecstatic Dancing - Soft Cell [1982]	


Non-Stop Ecstatic Dancing is a short album (EP) released in 1982 by Soft Cell, a pioneering synthpop/new wave duo which featured Marc Almond singing and David Ball playing synthesizers. The album produced a hit single, "What?," as well as remixes of both sides of the band's first single, "Memorabilia" and "A Man Could Get Lost."
Non-Stop Ecstatic Dancing is widely recognized as being one of the first house records in the UK, as well as the first record in the UK to feature turntable scratches. However, it is notable that the scratch sounds heard on the record were not created on actual turntables but, rather, on producer Mike Thorne's modular Serge synthesizer.


Track Listings

[01] Memorabilia
[02] Where Did Our Love Go
[03] What
[04] A Man Could Get Lost
[05] Chips On My Shoulder
[06] Sex Dwarf
